result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick James Schaefer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber granted.  Report clean and sober.

Consecutive to: to any other sentence

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Bond to be applied; balance to be returned to poster.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick James Schaefer

defendant.name: Schaefer, Patrick James
defendant.address: W6014 S Elk Dr, Westfield, WI 53964

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Patrick James Schaefer in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant agrees.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 10 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before February 3, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Court Costs = 243.00
Credit = 0 days
bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it.
Criminal Complaint served on Defendant @ Courthouse by MASO

Pre-trial conference on November 8, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Return date on December 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Patrick James Schaefer in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver of Attorney made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and Pre-Trial
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2016 at 09:15 am.

Statement of Compliance
